intro: Grumilea bataanensis, commonly known as the Bataan grumihua, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland areas with moist, well-drained soils. It is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
